Package com.mhealthatlas.usermanagement.controller

Class UserManagementCommandController

java.lang.Object
com.mhealthatlas.usermanagement.controller.UserManagementCommandController
@Controller
@RequestMapping("/user-management")
public class UserManagementCommandController
extends java.lang.Object
UserManagementCommandController is the class containing all API endpoints for mutating user informations.

  • Method Details

    • postUserSpecialization

      @PostMapping("/users/{userId}/specializations/{specializationId}") @PreAuthorize("hasRole(\'ROLE_Admin\') || #userId.toString() == authentication.name") @ResponseStatus(CREATED) @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Void> postUserSpecialization​(@PathVariable java.util.UUID userId, @PathVariable java.lang.Long specializationId)
      Creates a new user specialization mapping. The created mapping is not validated.

      The method can be invoked with an HTTP POST request calling /user-management/users/{userId}/specializations/{specializationId}

      A mHealthAtlas user can access this API endpoint, if he creates a new mapping for himself. Only mHealthAtlas administrators can access the API endpoint for all users.

      Parameters:
      userId - the user id; not null; request path parameter
      specializationId - the specialization id; not null; request parameter
      Returns:
      201 CREATED response, if the user specialization mapping was created successfully;
      422 UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY otherwise;

    • deleteUserSpecialization

      @DeleteMapping("/users/{userId}/specializations/{specializationId}") @PreAuthorize("hasRole(\'ROLE_Admin\') || #userId.toString() == authentication.name") @ResponseStatus(OK) @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Void> deleteUserSpecialization​(@PathVariable java.util.UUID userId, @PathVariable java.lang.Long specializationId)
      Deletes an existing user specialization mapping.

      The method can be invoked with an HTTP DELETE request calling /user-management/users/{userId}/specializations/{specializationId}

      A mHealthAtlas user can access this API endpoint, if he deletes an existing mapping for himself. Only mHealthAtlas administrators can access the API endpoint for all users.

      Parameters:
      userId - the user id; not null; request path parameter
      specializationId - the specialization id; not null; request parameter
      Returns:
      200 OK response, if the user specialization mapping was deleted successfully;
      422 UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY otherwise;

    • updateUserSpecialization

      @PostMapping("/users/{userId}/specializations/{specializationId}/is-valid/{status}") @PreAuthorize("hasRole(\'ROLE_Admin\')") @ResponseStatus(OK) @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Void> updateUserSpecialization​(@PathVariable java.util.UUID userId, @PathVariable java.lang.Long specializationId, @PathVariable java.lang.Boolean status)
      Updates an existing user specialization mapping.

      The method can be invoked with an HTTP POST request calling /user-management/users/{userId}/specializations/{specializationId}/is-valid/{status}

      Only mHealthAtlas administrators can access the API endpoint.

      Parameters:
      userId - the user id; not null; request path parameter
      specializationId - the specialization id; not null; request parameter
      status - the specialization status (validated, challenged); not null; request parameter
      Returns:
      200 OK response, if the user specialization mapping was updated successfully;
      422 UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY otherwise;

    • postUser

      @PostMapping("/users/{userId}") @PreAuthorize("hasRole(\'ROLE_Admin\') || #userId.toString() == authentication.name") @ResponseStatus(OK) @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Void> postUser​(@PathVariable java.util.UUID userId, @RequestBody UserDto user)
      Updates an existing user.

      The method can be invoked with an HTTP POST request calling /user-management/users/{userId}

      A mHealthAtlas user can access this API endpoint for himself. Only mHealthAtlas administrators can access the API endpoint.

      Parameters:
      userId - the user id; not null; request path parameter
      user - the specialization id; not null; required request body parameter
      Returns:
      200 OK response, if the user was updated successfully;
      422 UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY, if the user was not found;
      500 INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR, otherwise

    • deleteUser

      @DeleteMapping("/users/{userId}") @PreAuthorize("hasRole(\'ROLE_Admin\') || #userId.toString() == authentication.name") @ResponseStatus(OK) @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Void> deleteUser​(@PathVariable java.util.UUID userId)
      Deletes an existing user.

      The method can be invoked with an HTTP DELETE request calling /user-management/users/{userId}

      A mHealthAtlas user can access this API endpoint for himself. Only mHealthAtlas administrators can access the API endpoint.

      Parameters:
      userId - the user id; not null; request path parameter
      Returns:
      200 OK response, if the user was deleted successfully;
      500 INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR, otherwise

    • postUserRole

      @PostMapping("/users/{userId}/role/{role}") @PreAuthorize("hasRole(\'ROLE_Admin\')") @ResponseStatus(OK) @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Void> postUserRole​(@PathVariable java.util.UUID userId, @PathVariable Role role)
      Creates a new user role mapping.

      The method can be invoked with an HTTP POST request calling /user-management/users/{userId}/role/{role}

      Only mHealthAtlas administrators can access the API endpoint.

      Parameters:
      userId - the user id; not null; request path parameter
      role - the role; not null; request path parameter
      Returns:
      201 CREATED response, if the user role mapping was created successfully;
      422 UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY, if the user was not found;
      500 INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR, otherwise

    • deleteUserRole

      @DeleteMapping("/users/{userId}/role/{role}") @PreAuthorize("hasRole(\'ROLE_Admin\')") @ResponseStatus(OK) @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Void> deleteUserRole​(@PathVariable java.util.UUID userId, @PathVariable Role role)
      Deletes an existing user role mapping.

      The method can be invoked with an HTTP DELETE request calling /user-management/users/{userId}/role/{role}

      Only mHealthAtlas administrators can access the API endpoint.

      Parameters:
      userId - the user id; not null; request path parameter
      role - the role; not null; request path parameter
      Returns:
      200 OK response, if the user role mapping was deleted successfully;
      422 UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY, if the user was not found;
      500 INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR, otherwise
